text: <@U2L125QGL|madhavi> has joined the channel

Hi All, 

If the chain code breaks at some point, i see that the handler itself is getting de-registered. 

[chaincode] processStream -> ERRO cd32 Error handling chaincode support stream: stream error: code = 1 desc = "context canceled"
Deregister handler:


How do we actually prevent de-registering? instead i just want to throw an error and continue.. 

Please suggest.
what do you mean throw an error? if the process dies it dies. If you catch the error and recover, it doesn't die.
<@U0P1VU0QG> How are you acquiring userCert. As I understand, HFC will get TCert while doing invoke internally, so dont need to pass cert explicitly
Hi all, i tried to deploy a chaincode from an git URL but I want to point to a specific branch. Is it possible to do so ? I can't make it work on Github URL
I also tagged and pointed to the .zip file, no success   :disappointed:
<@U0N4D2T61> sounds like a reasonable use case, if it doesnt work pls file JIRA
<@U0KPFAZNF> ok, i will open 2 features
ty
<@U0KPFAZNF>  <https://jira.hyperledger.org> is open to everyone ? How can I create an account ?
<@U0KPFAZNF> ok got it
cool
For others: I think the answer is you need an LFID
(which is free/open-to-all
you just need to create the account
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1133?filter=-2>
well, it looks not so hard to do but it helps a lot developers !
Hi, any word on who I should set as a reviewer for some fixes to shim.MockStub?
<@U0ZJZBJLF> : Thank you. SO what you say is , if i do the proper error handling, there shouldn't be an issue of de-register?
If your chaincode doesn't die, yeah
